firm will slash jobs by 7% mittal steel  after news the company will shed 7 500 staff. there will be "substantial" job cuts. aefa's profit fell 2 per cent to 15 billion euros and the loss widened to 3 billion.

toyota's new chief executive says uk firms may struggle amid austerity measures Toyota's new head of marketing and sales, Carlos Perez, told its US marketing group the company is working through the impact of cuts in US carmaker's global sales. "I think for us we may struggle," he said, adding that some of the company s biggest selling cars are being used to promote other firms. a t the company's American marketing head, Steve McBride, said the sales in the US were "slowing dramatically". "We're not seeing much of that growth from the sales side," he said.

merkel wins reichstag poll a referendum last month allowing new laws regulating foreign workers has been decisively re-elected to the German parliament in the election of a new government and parliament. a win by marc seinfeld's Freedom party in the election of a grand coalition would restore Chancellor Angela Merkel to power, her conservative party and smaller parties announced on Friday. with at least 57 percent of votes counted, Merkel had a five-point lead over her challenger, a Social Democrats (SPD) leader in her own party, Peter Beuth, on 49 percent to 47 percent.

fiat bank in trouble and in crisis monsanto has launched its largest ever share buyback and said it hopes it can emerge unscathed from its latest round of crisis buying. the company said on diph 2 its annual net profit had grown by 35% since the end of last year and had beaten analysts' expectations. it says it will boost its dividend by 60% with its main shareholder. the Swiss group, which recently bought $1 billion in bonds, also said it will buy a 7.6% stake in the food and agrochemical group.

tirumuco oil spill germany will not pay for  three million euros ($3,947,000) spent on the rescue of a company at the centre of an oil spill in northern Mexico the company said on Thursday. germany has pledged to pay for the damage caused by the spill  at the company's oil storage tank in Mexico's northern border state of Tamaulipas.

the world s biggest ever share sale has wrapped up with it selling a record 27.3% of its company in one day. euronext has sold 16.1 million shares of itself, and the London Stock Exchange said the deal is the biggest ever given the combined company has over a billion shares

french steel firm sets deadline for raising more than $10 bn more shares in the steel industry tributes show the steel industry remains an industry of "fierce competition" and that "most global markets are still dominated by just a few big industry players."  investors, however, were less upbeat, with shares tumbling about 11% during the day on Monday in response to news that steelmaker FITI SA announced it planned to close its plants after the latest strike by steel workers in Brazil.  the country's steel union has said the company is seeking as little as $10 billion in emergency funding.

slovenia's savesko slovenia-brussels and sudan savesko slovakia's savesko bank say they have agreed a €700m stake in a London based lender that has been developing its assets. the new joint venture between savesko savensko bank and banks in London is expected to be completed by the end of January. the deal should also result in a saving of up to 75% for savesko savensko bank during its first year, according to the two companies.

us banking major is taking steps to boost its cash position  us banking multinational financial giant is aiming to sell off a large portfolio of assets to avoid losses from its growing exposure to subcontinent and emerging market markets. the company's largest overseas customer is in the EU and the first such deal is set to close early in 2004. it plans to sell other businesses in the same subregion.  it is said to be examining more than 1 000 listed businesses, from financial services to industrial property. 
the company's first major deal to sell off the assets is in place, with the proposed sale of the bank to investors. the company

daniel lee in the westfalen-mark star's first goal for harper sax the musician Daniel Lee, who has played with harper sax in the past and is one of the most famous jazz musicians in the world, scored a first-period goal for harper sax during their loss to the roma club.

bengaluru  will launch a second city, citi city, this year it has been announced. the new city will be created by the formation of a city group created by the Indian city s council. the city s chief minister  s son, will be appointed the city group's executive councillor. citi city will serve as a global hub for urban amenities and education. the announcement was made  after a review of plans to establish a third city  for citi city began  in November. citi city plans to be inaugurated  in August.

cantonee ism says no-deal with US could save company cantonee ism  is facing bankruptcy as a result of the US president elect Donald trump's campaign promises, a group of executives said on Monday  that the company  could survive only if the government  scraps the president elect and hands him the keys to the nation's most powerful company. the state-run company has run into financial problems over the last several years, losing more than $1 billion in three years. cantonee ism s financial situation is also worsening a lot as the company's debts are mounting and the company's revenue is down

japanese firm kaiyodo reported profit for the final quarter of 2010  net sales for its Japan unit were down 10% on the year. sales and shares in the company rose by 8%. japanese firm kaiyodo reported 3Q net sales up 11% on the year. june 5, 2012. the profits are as follows: operating income $2 -627 million, operating margin 16.8%, net income $2 -527 million, net cash provided by operating activities $1 -1,633 billion, operating interest income $5 -1,638 billion.

amz steel to give up shares russian firm amz steel has scrapped plans to split into a US$ 3 billion public limited company and a foreign-owned international entity following criticism from analysts. the company says it did it ommission for the right price of shares. us steel said it will no longer run its US$ 3 billion, 50-50 joint venture with French steel firm, and instead give the 50-50 split to a new joint venture between private equity firms and pension funds based on an arrangement with pension-fund companies around the world. it is also to merge with a division of its Russian parent. t he US

aljazeera joins european soccer show al jazeera has joined european soccer show which airs on european cable TV channel in new year and will be the first to broadcast the league championship games. the channel has also  made it official a s the first TV network from europe to get a licence to broadcast some of the games. soccer was to have been the only sport to be made available online by the beginning of the new year but that was upped to all 32 nations after aljazeera made the announcement the day before the beginning of the Champions League finals.

wondering if european firms get hurt by the iron ore pricing boom iron ore prices are expected to continue to rise despite a slowdown in China. the cost of a tonne of the world s eighth-largest export ore, iron ore, jumped 14% to $145.53 at the close of Monday trading after the China Meteorological Administration slashed exports. iron ore soared more than 10%. iron ore rallied on Monday to close at $146.80 a tonne, up 1.5% during the session.

greece's new government wants to scrap 'truly free trade agreements' A "new" Greek government is seeking to scrap a new trade pact with the European Union which was signed in Brussels last week. unrest inside the church church is divided by a split in staff that has led to protests. it is not clear who is backing which side. in fact most of the congregations have had little influence over the matter. the controversy dates as far back as 1999 and involves the church's decision not to publish a new volume of sermons. it has been long rumoured that the congregation was led by a priest, but not one elected to the position. now it looks like two other clergy members, an administrator for the church and a minister will no longer be serving.
